diff_hunk:
@@ -629,6 +629,13 @@ def _load_from_state_dict(self, state_dict, prefix, strict, missing_keys, unexpe
             key = prefix + name
             if key in state_dict:
                 input_param = state_dict[key]
+
+                if input_param.shape != param.shape:
+                    # local shape should match the one in checkpoint
+                    error_msgs.append('Size mismatch: copying a param of {} from checkpoint, '
body:
It won't trigger if the shapes are broadcastable, which is why we need this check here. But if they are not broadcastable, it will trigger, and then we have two error messages. :) 

I'm not sure that I understand the point about all mismatched keys. Could you give an example?
